Constantine II of Greece

Constantine II was the last King of Greece, reigning from 1964 until the abolition of the monarchy in 1973. He was the second child and only son of King Paul and Queen Frederica, and his older sister was Sophia, who later became Queen of Spain. Constantine's reign was marked by a tumultuous period in Greek history, including a military dictatorship, a royal countercoup, and ultimately, the abolition of the monarchy.

# Early life

## World War II and the exile of the royal family

Constantine was born on June 2, 1940, in Athens, Greece. His early life was marked by the turmoil of World War II. In 1941, when Constantine was just a year old, the German army invaded Greece, and the royal family was forced to flee the country. They first went to Crete, and then to Egypt, where they remained for several years. During this time, Constantine's father, King Paul, served as the commander-in-chief of the Greek forces in the Middle East.

## After World War II and return to Greece

After the end of World War II, the royal family returned to Greece in 1946. Constantine's father, King Paul, ascended to the throne in 1947, following the death of his brother, King George II. Constantine was just seven years old at the time. He spent his childhood in the royal palace in Athens, surrounded by his family and the trappings of royalty.

# Crown Prince

## Education

As the Crown Prince, Constantine received a privileged education. He attended the Anargyrios and Korgialenios School of Spetses, a prestigious boarding school on the island of Spetses. He later studied at the Hellenic Military Academy, where he graduated as a second lieutenant in 1958.

## Sailing and the Olympic Games

Constantine was an accomplished sailor and represented Greece at the 1960 Summer Olympics in Rome, where he won a gold medal in the Dragon class. He was the youngest member of the Greek team at the time. Constantine's love of sailing continued throughout his life, and he remained a prominent figure in the sailing world.

# Reign

## Accession and marriage

Constantine ascended to the throne on March 6, 1964, following the death of his father, King Paul. He was just 23 years old at the time. In September of the same year, he married Anne-Marie of Denmark, the youngest daughter of King Frederick IX of Denmark. The wedding was a grand affair, attended by royalty and dignitaries from around the world.

## Apostasia of 1965

One of the earliest challenges Constantine faced as king was the Apostasia of 1965, a constitutional crisis caused by a dispute between the king and the government over the appointment of a new prime minister. The crisis was eventually resolved, but it marked a difficult start to Constantine's reign.

## Greek dictatorship of 1967–1974

In 1967, a group of army officers seized power in a military coup, establishing a dictatorship that lasted for seven years. Constantine initially supported the coup, but he soon realized that the regime was not going to restore democracy as promised. He began to secretly work against the regime, but his efforts were ultimately unsuccessful.

## Royal countercoup of 13 December 1967 and exile

On December 13, 1967, Constantine launched a countercoup against the military regime, but it failed, and he was forced to flee the country. He went into exile in Rome, Italy, where he remained for several years.

# Restoration of democracy and the referendum

In 1974, the military dictatorship collapsed, and democracy was restored in Greece. A referendum was held in December of the same year, in which the Greek people voted to abolish the monarchy. Constantine, who had returned to Greece for the referendum, was defeated, and the monarchy was officially abolished.

# Life in exile after 1974

## Abortive conspiracies

After the abolition of the monarchy, Constantine returned to exile in London, where he remained for several years. During this time, he was involved in several abortive conspiracies to restore the monarchy, but they were ultimately unsuccessful.

## 1993 visit to Greece

In 1993, Constantine visited Greece for the first time since his exile. The visit was a low-key affair, and he was met with a mixture of curiosity and hostility.

## Legal quarrels over the royal properties

Constantine was involved in several legal battles over the royal properties, which had been seized by the Greek state after the abolition of the monarchy. He eventually won a court case in the European Court of Human Rights, which ruled that the Greek state had to compensate him for the loss of the properties.

# Later life

## Death

Constantine died on January 10, 2023, at the age of 82, in Athens, Greece. He had been in poor health for several years before his death.

# Issue

Constantine and his wife, Anne-Marie, had five children:

1. Alexia of Greece and Denmark (born 1965)
2. Pavlos, Crown Prince of Greece (born 1967)
3. Nikolaos of Greece and Denmark (born 1969)
4. Theodora of Greece and Denmark (born 1983)
5. Philippos of Greece and Denmark (born 1986)

# Ancestry

Constantine was a member of the House of Glücksburg, a branch of the House of Oldenburg. His ancestry includes several European royal families, including the British, Danish, and Russian royal families.

House of the Dragon is an American fantasy drama television series created by Ryan Condal and George R. R. Martin for HBO. As Adonis prepares to face Damian in the ring, he must confront his own demons and the legacy of his father, Apollo Creed. article:
Hunting Success

Hunting success refers to the effectiveness of a predator's hunting efforts, typically measured by the number of successful kills or captures of prey. This concept is crucial in understanding the ecology and behavior of predators, as well as the dynamics of predator-prey relationships. Hunting success is influenced by various factors, including the predator's physical and behavioral characteristics, environmental conditions, and the characteristics of the prey. In this article, we will explore the concept of hunting success in animals, including a list of animals by hunting success rate, and discuss the factors that influence hunting success in both animals and humans.

# Definition

Hunting success is defined as the proportion of hunting attempts that result in a successful kill or capture of prey. It is a measure of a predator's effectiveness in obtaining food and is often used as an indicator of a species' ecological fitness. Hunting success can be measured in various ways, including the number of kills per unit of time, the number of successful hunts per total number of hunts, or the proportion of prey captured relative to the number of prey encountered.

# Hunting success in animals

Hunting success varies widely across different animal species, depending on factors such as the predator's physical and behavioral characteristics, the characteristics of the prey, and environmental conditions. Some predators, such as lions and wolves, are highly successful hunters, while others, such as cheetahs and hyenas, have lower success rates.

## List of animals by hunting success rate

Here is a list of animals by their estimated hunting success rates:

* Lion: 50-60%
* Wolf: 40-50%
* Leopard: 30-40%
* Cheetah: 20-30%
* Hyena: 10-20%
* Polar bear: 5-10%
* Great white shark: 5-10%

Note: These estimates vary widely depending on the source and the specific population being studied.

## Reasons for high hunting success

Several factors contribute to high hunting success in animals, including:

* Specialized physical characteristics, such as sharp claws, powerful jaws, or speed.
* Advanced sensory abilities, such as keen eyesight, hearing, or smell.
* Complex social behavior, such as cooperative hunting or communication.
* Adaptation to specific environments, such as deserts or forests.

# Kill rates

Kill rates refer to the number of kills made by a predator per unit of time. Kill rates are often used to estimate a predator's hunting success and can be influenced by various factors, including the predator's physical and behavioral characteristics, environmental conditions, and the characteristics of the prey. Kill rates can be measured in various ways, including the number of kills per day, week, or month.

# Factors influencing success

Several factors influence hunting success in animals, including:

## Selective feeding

Selective feeding refers to the tendency of predators to target specific prey species or individuals. This behavior can be influenced by various factors, including the predator's physical and behavioral characteristics, the characteristics of the prey, and environmental conditions. Selective feeding can increase hunting success by allowing predators to focus on the most vulnerable or nutritious prey.

## Social and solitary predators

Social predators, such as lions and wolves, often have higher hunting success rates than solitary predators, such as cheetahs and hyenas. This is because social predators can coordinate their hunting efforts and share the risks and rewards of hunting.

## Hunting methods

Different hunting methods, such as stalking, ambushing, or chasing, can influence hunting success. For example, predators that use stealth and ambush tactics, such as lions and leopards, often have higher success rates than those that use chase tactics, such as cheetahs and hyenas.

## Environmental influences

Environmental factors, such as vegetation, terrain, and weather, can influence hunting success. For example, predators that hunt in open environments, such as grasslands or savannas, often have higher success rates than those that hunt in dense environments, such as forests or deserts.

## Vegetative cover

Vegetative cover, such as grasses, shrubs, or trees, can provide cover for both predators and prey. Dense vegetative cover can reduce hunting success by making it more difficult for predators to detect and pursue prey.

# In human hunters

Hunting success in humans is influenced by various factors, including the hunter's physical and behavioral characteristics, environmental conditions, and the characteristics of the prey.

## Hunting success in humans

Hunting success in humans varies widely depending on the specific population and the type of hunting being practiced. For example, indigenous hunters in some parts of the world have high success rates due to their traditional knowledge and skills, while recreational hunters in other parts of the world may have lower success rates due to their lack of experience and skill.

## Factors influencing success of human hunters

Several factors influence hunting success in humans, including:

* Physical and behavioral characteristics, such as strength, endurance, and marksmanship.
* Environmental conditions, such as terrain, weather, and vegetation.
* Characteristics of the prey, such as behavior, habitat, and population density.
* Type of hunting being practiced, such as subsistence, recreational, or commercial.

## Hunting types and methods

Different types of hunting, such as bowhunting, rifle hunting, or trapping, can influence hunting success. For example, bowhunters often have lower success rates than rifle hunters due to the shorter range and lower accuracy of bows.

## Impact

Hunting success can have significant impacts on ecosystems and human societies. For example, overhunting can lead to population declines or even extinctions, while sustainable hunting practices can help maintain healthy populations and support conservation efforts.

Vikram (2022 film)

Vikram is a 2022 Indian Tamil-language action thriller film written and directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj. The film stars Kamal Haasan, Vijay Sethupathi, and Fahadh Faasil in lead roles, with Kalidas Jayaram, Narain, and Chemban Vinod Jose playing pivotal roles. The film marks Kamal Haasan's return to the big screen after a four-year hiatus.

# Plot

The film follows the story of Amar (Kamal Haasan), a former agent of the Indian government, who is brought back into action to take down a mysterious and deadly gang. As Amar delves deeper into the case, he realizes that the gang is being led by a man named Sandhanam (Vijay Sethupathi), a former colleague turned rogue. As Amar gets closer to the truth, he must confront his past and team up with a new agent, Agent Tina (Kalidas Jayaram), to take down Sandhanam and his gang.

However, things take a turn when Amar discovers that Sandhanam is being manipulated by a mysterious figure known as Rolex (Fahadh Faasil), a high-ranking official with connections to the government. As Amar navigates the complex web of corruption and deceit, he must use all his skills and experience to take down Rolex and bring the truth to light.

# Cast

* Kamal Haasan as Amar
* Vijay Sethupathi as Sandhanam
* Fahadh Faasil as Rolex
* Kalidas Jayaram as Agent Tina
* Narain as Bejoy
* Chemban Vinod Jose as Augustin

# Production

## Development

The film was first announced in November 2020, with Kamal Haasan and Lokesh Kanagaraj teaming up for the first time. The film's script was written by Kanagaraj, who had previously directed films like Kaithi and Master. The film's story was inspired by the 1986 film Vikram, which was also directed by Kamal Haasan.

## Casting

The film's cast was announced in January 2021, with Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil joining the cast. Kalidas Jayaram, Narain, and Chemban Vinod Jose were also added to the cast in the following months.

## Filming

The film's principal photography began in July 2021 and wrapped up in February 2022. The film was shot extensively in Chennai, Hyderabad, and Dubai. The film's action sequences were choreographed by Anbu Arivu, who had previously worked on films like Kaithi and Master.

# Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by Anirudh Ravichander, who had previously worked on films like Petta and Darbar. The film's score was a mix of electronic and rock elements, with the title track "Vikram" becoming a huge hit.

# Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in March 2022, with the release of the film's teaser. The film's trailer was released in May 2022, which generated a lot of buzz on social media.

# Release

## Theatrical

The film was released on June 3, 2022, in over 5000 theaters worldwide. The film received a huge opening, with many shows selling out in advance.

### Screenings and statistics

The film had a huge opening weekend, with the film grossing over ₹100 crore in India alone. The film also performed well in overseas markets, with the film grossing over ₹50 crore in the United States.

## Distribution

The film was distributed by Red Giant Movies in Tamil Nadu, with the film being released in over 1000 theaters in the state. The film was also distributed by Reliance Entertainment in other parts of India.

## Home media and screenplay

The film's digital rights were sold to Amazon Prime Video, with the film streaming on the platform from July 2022. The film's screenplay was also released as a book, with the book becoming a bestseller.

## Film festival

The film was screened at the 2022 Toronto International Film Festival, with the film receiving a standing ovation.

# Reception

## Box office

The film was a huge commercial success, with the film grossing over ₹500 crore worldwide. The film also became the highest-grossing Tamil film of 2022.

## Critical reception

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's action sequences, performances, and direction. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising the film's bold and stylish direction.

## Accolades

The film won several awards, including the Best Film award at the 2022 Filmfare Awards South. Kamal Haasan also won the Best Actor award at the ceremony.

# Future

A sequel to the film is reportedly in the works, with Lokesh Kanagaraj set to direct the film again. The film's script is currently in development, with the film expected to go on floors in 2024.

# Notes

Vikram was a game-changer for Tamil cinema, with the film's success paving the way for more big-budget films in the industry. The film's success also marked a comeback for Kamal Haasan, who had been away from the big screen for several years.

Sita Ramam is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language period romantic drama film written and directed by Hanu Raghavapudi. The film stars Dulquer Salmaan, Mrunal Thakur, Rashmika Mandanna, and Sumanth. The movie is set in the 1960s and follows the story of a soldier who falls in love with a woman named Sita Mahalakshmi.

# Plot

The film is set in the 1960s, during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965. Lieutenant Ram, a soldier in the Indian Army, is stationed in Kashmir. He meets Sita Mahalakshmi, a woman who is on a pilgrimage to the holy shrine of Amarnath. The two share a romantic bond, and Ram writes letters to Sita, expressing his love for her.

However, their love is put to the test when Ram is accused of being a Pakistani spy and is imprisoned. Sita sets out on a mission to clear Ram's name and prove his innocence. Along the way, she faces numerous challenges and obstacles, including the harsh terrain of Kashmir and the suspicion of the Indian Army.

As Sita struggles to clear Ram's name, she also uncovers a deeper conspiracy involving the Indian government and the Pakistani Army. The film's climax features a dramatic showdown between Sita and the conspirators, with Ram's fate hanging in the balance.

# Soundtrack

article:
Amber Heard
=============

Amber Laura Heard is an American actress and model. Born on April 22, 1986, in Austin, Texas, Heard rose to prominence in the late 2000s and has since become a prominent figure in Hollywood.

Early life
==========

Heard was born to Paige Parsons, an internet researcher, and David Heard, a contractor. She has a younger sister, Whitney Heard. The family lived in Austin, Texas, where Heard grew up. She attended St. Michael's Catholic Academy in Austin and later dropped out to pursue a career in modeling.

Heard began her career in modeling at the age of 16, moving to New York City to pursue opportunities in the fashion industry. She appeared in several commercials and campaigns, including those for Express, Guess, and Abercrombie & Fitch.

Career
=======

### 2003–2007: Early roles

Heard began her acting career in the early 2000s, landing small roles in films such as "Friday Night Lights" (2004) and "Drop Dead Sexy" (2005). She also appeared in several television shows, including "Jack & Bobby" and "The O.C.".

In 2007, Heard landed a supporting role in the comedy-drama "Alpha Dog", alongside Justin Timberlake and Anton Yelchin. The film premiered at the Sundance Film Festival and received positive reviews.

### 2008–2016: Mainstream recognition

Heard's breakthrough role came in 2008 with the release of "Pineapple Express", a stoner comedy starring Seth Rogen and James Franco. The film was a commercial success, grossing over $87 million worldwide.

In 2009, Heard appeared in the horror film "The Stepfather", a remake of the 1987 film of the same name. The film received mixed reviews, but Heard's performance was praised.

In 2010, Heard starred alongside Nicolas Cage in the action film "The Ward". The film was released to mixed reviews, but Heard's performance was praised.

In 2011, Heard appeared in the drama "The Rum Diary", alongside Johnny Depp. The film was a critical and commercial success, grossing over $24 million worldwide.

In 2015, Heard appeared in the blockbuster film "Magic Mike XXL", alongside Channing Tatum and Joe Manganiello. The film grossed over $122 million worldwide.

### 2017–present: DC Extended Universe and other projects

In 2017, Heard was cast as Mera in the DC Extended Universe film "Justice League". The film was released to mixed reviews, but Heard's performance was praised.

In 2018, Heard reprised her role as Mera in "Aquaman", which grossed over $1.1 billion worldwide.

Heard has several upcoming projects, including "Aquaman 2" and "The Stand".

Charity and activism
=====================

Heard is a longtime supporter of several charitable organizations, including the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) and the Rape Treatment Center at Santa Monica-UCLA Medical Center.

In 2015, Heard was appointed as a Human Rights Champion by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime.

Personal life
=============

### Relationship with Johnny Depp

Heard met Johnny Depp on the set of "The Rum Diary" in 2010. The two began a romantic relationship and became engaged in 2014. They married in February 2015.

#### Australian customs incident

In 2015, Heard and Depp were involved in a controversy surrounding the importation of their dogs into Australia. The couple was accused of smuggling the dogs into the country, and Heard pleaded guilty to falsifying immigration documents. She was fined $1,000 and released on a good behavior bond.

#### Divorce

In May 2016, Heard filed for divorce from Depp, citing irreconcilable differences. The divorce was finalized in August 2016.

#### Depp v News Group Newspapers Ltd

In 2018, Depp sued News Group Newspapers Ltd, the publisher of The Sun, over an article that alleged he was a "wife beater". Heard testified on behalf of the newspaper, stating that Depp had been violent towards her during their relationship.

#### Depp v. Heard

In 2019, Depp sued Heard for defamation over an op-ed she wrote for The Washington Post, in which she described herself as a survivor of domestic abuse. The lawsuit is ongoing.

Protests against the Russian invasion of Ukraine

The Russian invasion of Ukraine, which began on February 24, 2022, has sparked widespread protests and condemnation from around the world. In Russia, protests have been met with a crackdown on dissent, while outside the country, people have taken to the streets to show solidarity with Ukraine and condemn Russia's actions.

#In Russia

Despite the risks of arrest and persecution, many Russians have taken to the streets to protest against the invasion of Ukraine. Protests have been held in cities across the country, with demonstrators calling for an end to the war and the withdrawal of Russian troops from Ukraine.

article:
Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
=====================================

Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse is a 2022 American computer-animated superhero film produced by Columbia Pictures, Sony Pictures Animation, and Marvel Entertainment. The film is a sequel to Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (2018) and follows Miles Morales as he teams up with other Spider-Men from different dimensions to stop a threat to the multiverse.

Plot
-----

The film takes place after the events of the first movie and follows Miles Morales as he is struggling to balance his personal life and his life as Spider-Man. He is soon visited by Spider-Gwen, who informs him that a new threat to the multiverse has emerged. The threat is revealed to be a powerful villain known as the Spot, who has the ability to travel through dimensions and is using his powers to destroy entire universes.

Miles and Spider-Gwen team up with other Spider-Men from different dimensions, including Spider-Man 2099, Spider-Man Noir, Spider-Ham, and Peni Parker, to stop the Spot. Along the way, they encounter various obstacles and challenges as they navigate through different dimensions and timelines.

As the team gets closer to stopping the Spot, they realize that his powers are not the only thing they need to worry about. They also have to deal with the consequences of their own actions and the impact they have on the different universes they visit.

Voice Cast

article:
2023 Writers Guild of America strike

The 2023 Writers Guild of America (WGA) strike was a labor dispute that began in April 2023, involving the Writers Guild of America, East (WGAE) and the Writers Guild of America, West (WGAW), which represent writers in the film, television, and digital media industries. The strike resulted from disagreements over issues such as compensation, working conditions, and the impact of technological advancements on the industry.

#Issues in the strike

The WGA negotiating committee identified several key issues that led to the strike:

*   Fair compensation for writers in the streaming era, including residuals and script fees
*   Improved working conditions, including reasonable script delivery schedules and limitations on writers' room hours
*   Increased transparency and accountability in the writers' room, including the use of AI-generated content
*   Greater diversity and inclusion in the industry, including more opportunities for underrepresented groups

#Timeline of negotiations and strike activity

##April 2023

In April 2023, the WGA negotiating committee began formal negotiations with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers (AMPTP), which represents the major film and television studios. The WGA presented its initial proposals, which included increased compensation for writers, improved working conditions, and greater transparency in the writers' room.

##May 2023

In May 2023, the AMPTP responded to the WGA's proposals, offering a package of concessions that included modest increases in compensation and some improvements to working conditions. However, the WGA rejected the proposal, citing concerns that it did not adequately address the key issues at stake.

##June 2023

In June 2023, the WGA announced that it would begin preparing for a potential strike, including the creation of a strike fund and the organization of picket lines. The AMPTP responded by accusing the WGA of being "unreasonable" and "unwilling to compromise."

##July 2023

In July 2023, the WGA negotiating committee met with the AMPTP for a final round of talks before the expiration of the current contract. The talks broke down, and the WGA announced that it would go on strike at midnight on July 31.

##August 2023

In August 2023, the WGA began picketing major film and television studios, including Warner Bros., Universal, and Paramount. The AMPTP responded by accusing the WGA of "disrupting" the industry and "hurting" working-class employees.

##September 2023

In September 2023, the WGA expanded its picketing efforts to include cable networks and streaming services. The AMPTP responded by filing a complaint with the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB), alleging that the WGA was engaging in "unfair labor practices."

##October 2023

In October 2023, the WGA negotiating committee met with the AMPTP for a new round of talks. The talks resulted in a tentative agreement, which included significant concessions on compensation, working conditions, and transparency.

#WGA negotiating committee

The WGA negotiating committee was led by WGAE President Michael Winship and WGAW President Meredith Stiehm. The committee included a diverse group of writers from the film, television, and digital media industries.

#Productions impacted

The strike impacted a wide range of film and television productions, including:

*   Major motion pictures, such as blockbuster sequels and franchise films
*   Television shows, including scripted dramas and comedies
*   Cable networks, including premium channels and basic cable networks
*   Streaming services, including Netflix, Amazon Prime, and Hulu

#Response

##Actors during the WGA strike

Many actors expressed support for the writers, including major stars and working-class actors. The Screen Actors Guild (SAG-AFTRA) issued a statement in support of the WGA, citing concerns about the impact of the strike on actors and the industry as a whole.

##Elected officials

Elected officials, including members of Congress and state legislatures, expressed support for the WGA. Some officials issued statements or resolutions in support of the strike, while others met with WGA leaders to discuss the issues at stake.

##Other unions

Other unions, including the Directors Guild of America (DGA) and the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees (IATSE), expressed support for the WGA. Some unions issued statements or resolutions in support of the strike, while others provided financial or logistical support to the WGA.

###Foreign unions

Foreign unions, including the British Writers' Guild and the Canadian Writers' Guild, expressed support for the WGA. Some unions issued statements or resolutions in support of the strike, while others provided financial or logistical support to the WGA.

##Film and television executives

Film and television executives, including studio heads and network executives, expressed opposition to the strike. Some executives accused the WGA of being "unreasonable" or "greedy," while others downplayed the impact of the strike on the industry.

##Strikebreaking efforts

The AMPTP attempted to break the strike by hiring non-union writers or using AI-generated content. However, the WGA responded by organizing picket lines and filing complaints with the NLRB.

article:
David Crosby
================

David Van Cortlandt Crosby (August 14, 1941 – January 18, 2023) was an American singer, songwriter, and musician. He was a founding member of the folk rock bands The Byrds and Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young (CSNY), and he also had a successful solo career. Crosby was known for his distinctive voice, introspective songwriting, and activism, which have made him a beloved figure in the music world.

Early years
------------

David Crosby was born in Los Angeles, California, to Aliph Van Cortlandt Whitehead, a cinematographer, and Floyd Crosby, a cinematographer and Academy Award winner. He grew up in a family of artists and musicians, with his father being a fan of jazz and classical music. Crosby's early life was marked by a love of music, and he began playing the guitar at the age of 13.

Crosby attended Cate School in Carpinteria, California, and later enrolled at Santa Barbara City College. However, he dropped out of college to pursue a career in music. In the early 1960s, Crosby began performing in folk clubs in Los Angeles, where he met musicians such as Roger McGuinn and Gene Clark.

Musical career
----------------

### The Byrds

In 1964, Crosby co-founded The Byrds with Roger McGuinn, Gene Clark, Michael Clarke, and Chris Hillman. The band's unique blend of folk rock and psychedelic rock produced hits such as "Mr. Tambourine Man" and "Turn! Turn! Turn!". Crosby's contributions to the band included his distinctive vocals and songwriting skills.

However, Crosby's time with The Byrds was marked by tension and conflict, particularly with McGuinn. Crosby's behavior became increasingly erratic, and he was eventually fired from the band in 1967.

### Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young

In 1968, Crosby joined forces with Stephen Stills and Graham Nash to form Crosby, Stills & Nash (CSN). The trio's harmonious vocals and introspective songwriting produced hits such as "Suite: Judy Blue Eyes" and "Guinnevere". The band's debut album, "Crosby, Stills & Nash", was released in 1969 and became a huge success.

In 1969, Neil Young joined the band, and they became Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young (CSNY). The band's music became more experimental and psychedelic, producing hits such as "Ohio" and "Teach Your Children". CSNY's music became a defining sound of the 1960s counterculture movement.

### 1971–2022: Solo career and Crosby & Nash

After CSNY disbanded in 1970, Crosby pursued a solo career. His debut solo album, "If I Could Only Remember My Name", was released in 1971 and featured guest appearances by CSNY bandmates and other notable musicians.

In the 1970s and 1980s, Crosby released several solo albums, including "Oh Yes I Can" and "Thousand Roads". He also collaborated with Graham Nash on several albums, including "Graham Nash/David Crosby" and "Whistling Down the Wire".

### 1996–2004: CPR

In 1996, Crosby formed the band CPR with James Raymond and Jeff Pevar. The band released several albums, including "CPR" and "Just Like Gravity". CPR's music was a blend of rock, jazz, and folk, featuring intricate instrumental arrangements and introspective lyrics.

Personal life and death
------------------------

### Family

Crosby was married to Jan Dance from 1987 until his death. The couple had a son, Donovan Crosby, in 1995.

Crosby also had several other children from previous relationships, including James Raymond, Melissa Etheridge's children Beckett and Bailey, and Donovan's half-sister, Claire.

### Cannabis brand

In 2018, Crosby launched a cannabis brand called Mighty Croz, which features a range of cannabis products, including flowers, concentrates, and edibles.

### Sailing

Crosby was an avid sailor and owned a yacht called the Mayan. He often sailed with his bandmates and friends, and his love of sailing inspired several of his songs.

### Politics

Crosby was a vocal advocate for social justice and environmental causes. He was a longtime supporter of the Democratic Party and performed at several benefit concerts for progressive causes.

### Acting career

Crosby appeared in several films and television shows, including "The Committee" and "Hook". He also had a recurring role on the television show "The Simpsons".

### Drugs, alcohol, and arrests

Crosby struggled with addiction and substance abuse throughout his life. He was arrested several times for possession of cocaine and other controlled substances.

In 1982, Crosby was arrested for possession of cocaine and served several months in prison. He later became a vocal advocate for addiction recovery and spoke publicly about his struggles with addiction.

### Health issues and death

Crosby suffered from several health issues throughout his life, including liver disease and diabetes. In 1994, he underwent a liver transplant after being diagnosed with liver cancer.

Crosby died on January 18, 2023, at the age of 81, after a long illness. His death was announced by his bandmates and family, who remembered him as a beloved musician, activist, and friend.

article:
Scott Hall

Scott Hall is a professional wrestler best known for his time in the World Wrestling Federation (WWF, now known as WWE) and World Championship Wrestling (WCW). Born on October 20, 1958, in St. Mary's County, Maryland, Hall began his wrestling career in the mid-1980s, working for various regional promotions before joining the WWF in 1992. Over the course of his career, Hall became a four-time WWF Intercontinental Champion, a two-time WCW United States Heavyweight Champion, and a founding member of the New World Order (nWo) faction in WCW.

#Early life

Hall was born on October 20, 1958, in St. Mary's County, Maryland. Growing up, Hall was an athletic child, participating in sports such as baseball, football, and basketball. After graduating from high school, Hall attended St. Mary's College of Maryland, where he studied English and played baseball. However, Hall dropped out of college after one year to pursue a career in professional wrestling.

#Professional wrestling career

##Early career (1984–1985)

Hall began his professional wrestling career in 1984, working for various regional promotions in the United States. During this time, Hall developed his ring skills and honed his craft, competing against other up-and-coming wrestlers. In 1985, Hall joined the American Wrestling Association (AWA), where he began to gain more exposure and build a reputation as a talented young wrestler.

##American Wrestling Association (1985–1989)

During his time in the AWA, Hall competed against other notable wrestlers, including Curt Hennig and Larry Zbyszko. Hall's time in the AWA helped him develop his skills and gain experience, but he eventually left the promotion in 1989 to pursue other opportunities.

##World Wrestling Federation Tryouts (1987, 1990)

In 1987, Hall received a tryout with the World Wrestling Federation (WWF), but was not offered a contract at the time. Hall returned to the WWF for another tryout in 1990, but was again unsuccessful in securing a contract.

##World Championship Wrestling (1989)

In 1989, Hall joined World Championship Wrestling (WCW), where he competed as a mid-card wrestler. During his time in WCW, Hall feuded with other wrestlers, including Butch Reed and Terry Funk.

##International promotions (1990–1991)

In 1990, Hall began competing for various international promotions, including the United States Wrestling Association (USWA) and the World Wrestling Council (WWC). Hall's time in these promotions helped him gain more experience and build a reputation as a talented wrestler.

##Return to WCW (1991–1992)

In 1991, Hall returned to WCW, where he competed as a mid-card wrestler. During his time in WCW, Hall feuded with other wrestlers, including Ricky Steamboat and Diamond Dallas Page.

##World Wrestling Federation (1992–1996)

###Debut and various feuds (1992–1993)

Hall made his WWF debut in 1992, competing as a heel wrestler. During his early time in the WWF, Hall feuded with other wrestlers, including Bret Hart and Randy Savage.

###Record-setting Intercontinental Champion (1993–1996)

In 1993, Hall won the WWF Intercontinental Championship from Bret Hart, beginning a record-setting reign that lasted for 406 days. During his time as champion, Hall feuded with other wrestlers, including Razor Ramon and Shawn Michaels.

##Second return to WCW (1996–2000)

###New World Order (1996–1998)

In 1996, Hall returned to WCW, where he became a founding member of the New World Order (nWo) faction. As a member of the nWo, Hall feuded with other wrestlers, including Sting and Diamond Dallas Page.

###nWo reunion and championship reigns (1999–2000)

In 1999, Hall reunited with his nWo teammates, Kevin Nash and Hogan, and the three men dominated WCW. During this time, Hall won the WCW United States Heavyweight Championship on two occasions.

##Extreme Championship Wrestling and Japan (2000–2001)

In 2000, Hall joined Extreme Championship Wrestling (ECW), where he competed against other wrestlers, including Justin Credible and Tommy Dreamer. Hall also competed in Japan, working for various promotions, including New Japan Pro Wrestling.

##Return to WWF/E (2002)

In 2002, Hall returned to the WWF, which had been renamed World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE). During his time in WWE, Hall competed on the Raw brand, feuding with other wrestlers, including Stone Cold Steve Austin and The Rock.

##Total Nonstop Action Wrestling (2002–2005, 2007–2008)

In 2002, Hall joined Total Nonstop Action Wrestling (TNA), where he competed against other wrestlers, including AJ Styles and Samoa Joe. Hall left TNA in 2005, but returned to the promotion in 2007.

##Return to the WWC (2007)

In 2007, Hall returned to the World Wrestling Council, where he competed against other wrestlers, including Eddie Colon and Shane Sewell.

##Juggalo Championship Wrestling (2007–2009)

In 2007, Hall joined Juggalo Championship Wrestling, a promotion founded by Insane Clown Posse. During his time in JCW, Hall competed against other wrestlers, including 2 Tuff Tony and Vampiro.

##Return to TNA (2010)

In 2010, Hall returned to TNA, where he competed on the Impact! brand. During his time in TNA, Hall feuded with other wrestlers, including Eric Young and Rob Terry.

##Late career (2010–2021)

In the final years of his career, Hall competed sporadically, working for various independent promotions. Hall's last match took place in 2021, when he competed for the Coastal Championship Wrestling promotion.

#Legal issues

Hall has been involved in several legal issues throughout his career. In 1998, Hall was arrested for assault after a fight with a fan. Hall has also been arrested for driving under the influence and drug possession.

#Personal life

Hall has been open about his struggles with addiction and depression. In 2010, Hall appeared on the reality TV show "Celebrity Rehab with Dr. Drew," where he sought treatment for his addiction.

#Death

Scott Hall passed away on March 14, 2022, at the age of 63, due to complications from a heart attack.

#Other media

##Television

Hall has made appearances on various TV shows, including "The Larry Sanders Show," "Baywatch," and "Walker, Texas Ranger."

##Video games

Hall has appeared in several video games, including the WWE 2K series and the WCW/nWo Revenge game.

article:
Lightyear (film)

Lightyear is a 2022 American computer-animated science fiction action-adventure film produced by Walt Disney Pictures and Pixar Animation Studios. The film serves as a spin-off from the Toy Story franchise, specifically exploring the origins of the fictional character Buzz Lightyear, a space ranger action figure who has become a beloved character in the franchise.

#Plot

The film follows the story of Buzz Lightyear, a space ranger who is part of the Star Command, an elite group of space explorers dedicated to protecting the galaxy from evil forces. After being stranded on a distant planet, Buzz and his crew, including his trusted companion Astra, must find a way to return to Star Command and defeat the evil Emperor Zurg, who seeks to take over the galaxy.

As Buzz navigates the challenges of the planet, he must confront his own identity and the true nature of his existence as a space ranger. Along the way, he meets new allies, including a ragtag group of space explorers who become his friends and join him on his quest.

Throughout the film, Buzz faces numerous challenges, including treacherous landscapes, hostile alien creatures, and rival space rangers who seek to undermine his mission. As he battles to save the galaxy, Buzz must also confront the reality of his own mortality and the possibility that he may not be the hero he once thought he was.

#Voice cast

The film features an all-star voice cast, including Chris Evans as the voice of Buzz Lightyear. Evans brings his signature charm and wit to the role, bringing depth and nuance to the character. The film also features the voice talents of Keke Palmer, Peter Sohn, James Brolin, and John Ratzenberger, among others.

#Production

##Development

The development of Lightyear began in 2016, when Pixar Animation Studios announced plans to produce a spin-off film based on the character of Buzz Lightyear. The film was initially conceived as a live-action project, but it was later reworked as an animated film.

Angus MacLane, a veteran Pixar animator and director, was brought on board to helm the project. MacLane had previously directed several Pixar shorts, including "Small Fry" and "La Luna," and had worked on numerous other Pixar films as an animator and story artist.

##Casting

The casting process for Lightyear was extensive, with the filmmakers seeking out talented voice actors to bring the characters to life. Chris Evans was the first actor to be cast in the film, and he brought a level of enthusiasm and dedication to the role that helped to set the tone for the rest of the production.

##Animation and design

The animation and design of Lightyear were overseen by a team of veteran Pixar artists and technicians. The film features a unique visual style that blends traditional animation techniques with cutting-edge computer-generated imagery.

The film's production design was led by Grant Alexander, who drew inspiration from a range of sources, including classic science fiction films and futuristic concept art. The film's characters and vehicles were designed by a team of talented artists, who worked closely with the filmmakers to bring the world of Lightyear to life.

#Music

The score for Lightyear was composed by Michael Giacchino, a veteran film composer who has worked on numerous Pixar films, including "Up" and "Inside Out." The score features a sweeping, epic sound that perfectly captures the sense of adventure and excitement that defines the film.

#Marketing

The marketing campaign for Lightyear was extensive, with the filmmakers releasing a series of trailers and promotional materials in the months leading up to the film's release. The campaign focused on showcasing the film's stunning animation and action-packed sequences, as well as highlighting the talents of the voice cast.

#Release

##Theatrical

Lightyear was released in theaters on June 17, 2022, in the United States and Canada. The film received a wide release, playing on over 4,000 screens in North America.

##Ban and censorship

The film was banned in several countries due to its depiction of same-sex relationships, which sparked controversy among conservative groups. In the United Arab Emirates, the film was banned by the country's media regulatory body, which deemed the film's content to be "contrary to the country's values and principles."

##Home media

Lightyear was released on home media on August 30, 2022, in the United States and Canada. The film was available on digital platforms, including iTunes and Amazon Prime Video, as well as on DVD and Blu-ray.

#Reception

##Streaming viewership

Lightyear was a major hit on streaming platforms, with the film attracting millions of viewers in the weeks following its release. According to Nielsen Media Research, the film was the most-watched streaming movie of 2022, with over 1.3 billion minutes streamed in its first week of release.

##Box office

The film performed well at the box office, grossing over $225 million worldwide in its opening weekend. The film went on to gross over $450 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of 2022.

##Critical response

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's stunning animation, engaging storyline, and talented voice cast. The film holds a 91% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on over 200 reviews, with an average rating of 7.5/10.

##Accolades

Lightyear received numerous awards and nominations, including several Annie Awards and a BAFTA nomination for Best Animated Film.

**2022 Indonesia Masters**

The 2022 Indonesia Masters was a badminton tournament that took place at the Istora Gelora Bung Karno in Jakarta, Indonesia, from June 7 to June 12, 2022. The tournament was part of the 2022 BWF World Tour and was the eighth tournament of the Super 750 level.

**Tournament**

### Venue

The 2022 Indonesia Masters was held at the Istora Gelora Bung Karno, a multi-purpose indoor arena located in Jakarta, Indonesia. The arena has a seating capacity of 7,166 and has hosted numerous badminton tournaments in the past.

The 2022 Indonesia Masters was a Super 750 tournament, which means that it offered a total of 11,000 ranking points to the winners. The point distribution was as follows:

* Winner: 11,000 points

* Quarter-finalist: 6,050 points
* Round of 16: 4,320 points

article:
Women's Premier League (Cricket)

The Women's Premier League (WPL) is a professional Twenty20 cricket league in India, established by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) in 2022. The league is designed to promote women's cricket in India and provide a platform for female cricketers to showcase their skills. The WPL is considered a significant step towards the development of women's cricket in the country, following the success of the Indian Premier League (IPL) for men.

#History

The concept of a women's T20 league in India was first proposed in 2018, but it gained momentum in 2022 when the BCCI announced plans to launch a franchise-based league for women. The BCCI invited bids from interested parties to own teams in the league, and five franchises were eventually selected. The league was officially launched in August 2022, with the first season scheduled to take place in March 2023.

#Organisation

The WPL is governed by the BCCI, with the league's operations managed by a separate governing council. The council is responsible for overseeing the league's administration, including team management, scheduling, and broadcasting. The BCCI has also appointed a CEO to oversee the day-to-day operations of the league.

#Teams

The WPL features five teams, each representing a different city in India. The teams are:

* Delhi Capitals Women
* Gujarat Giants Women
* Mumbai Indians Women
* Royal Challengers Bangalore Women
* UP Warriorz Women

Each team has a squad of 15 players, with a maximum of six overseas players allowed per team. The teams were selected through a bidding process, with the owners of the teams being a mix of corporate entities and individual investors.

#Tournament seasons and results

The WPL season typically runs from March to May, with each team playing the other teams twice in a round-robin format. The top two teams in the league table qualify for the final, with the winner being crowned the champion.

##Finals

The WPL final is played between the top two teams in the league table, with the winner being decided by a single match. The final is typically played at a neutral venue, with the BCCI selecting the venue based on factors such as crowd support and infrastructure.

##Teams' performances

Each team's performance is measured by their win-loss record, with the team earning two points for a win and zero points for a loss. The team with the most points at the end of the league stage qualifies for the final.

#Records and statistics

The WPL has its own set of records and statistics, with the league maintaining a database of player and team performances. Some of the key records include:

* Most runs scored in a season
* Most wickets taken in a season
* Highest individual score
* Best bowling figures
* Most catches taken

#Financial background

The WPL is a franchise-based league, with each team owner paying a fee to participate in the league. The fee is set by the BCCI, and the owners are also required to pay a share of the revenue generated by the league. The revenue is generated through a combination of broadcasting rights, sponsorships, and ticket sales.

#Player auction

The WPL features a player auction, where teams bid for the services of players. The auction is typically held before the start of the season, with teams having a limited budget to spend on player salaries. The auction is a key feature of the league, with teams competing fiercely to sign the best players.

#Broadcasting

The WPL is broadcast live on television and online, with the BCCI selling the broadcasting rights to a media company. The broadcasting rights are a key source of revenue for the league, with the BCCI generating significant revenue from the sale of broadcasting rights.

#See also

* Indian Premier League (IPL)
* Big Bash League (BBL)
* Women's Big Bash League (WBBL)
* Women's Cricket World Cup

article:
Tiger 3

Tiger 3 is an upcoming Indian spy thriller film directed by Maneesh Sharma and produced by Aditya Chopra under the banner of Yash Raj Films. The film is the third installment in the Tiger film series, following Tiger Zinda Hai (2017) and Ek Tha Tiger (2012). The film stars Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif reprising their roles as Avinash Singh Rathore (Tiger) and Zoya Humaimi, respectively.

#Plot

The plot of Tiger 3 is centered around Avinash Singh Rathore (Tiger), a RAW agent who is on a mission to take down a powerful terrorist organization. The film is set several years after the events of Tiger Zinda Hai and follows Tiger as he navigates through a complex web of international espionage and counter-terrorism. Alongside Zoya, Tiger must use his skills and resources to take down the enemy and save the world from destruction.

#Cast

* Salman Khan as Avinash Singh Rathore (Tiger)
* Katrina Kaif as Zoya Humaimi
* Emraan Hashmi as the main antagonist
* Ranvir Shorey as Gopi Arya
* Girish Karnad as Shenoy
* Rupal Patel as Zoya's mother
* Paresh Rawal as Sajjad Durrani

#Production

##Development

The development of Tiger 3 began in 2019, with Maneesh Sharma being roped in to direct the film. Aditya Chopra, the producer of the film, was keen on taking the franchise forward and exploring new storylines. The script was written by Maneesh Sharma and Neelesh Misra, with inputs from Aditya Chopra. The film's story is an original concept and not based on any real-life events or literature.

##Casting

Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif were the first to be cast in the film, reprising their roles as Tiger and Zoya. Emraan Hashmi was later roped in to play the main antagonist, marking his first collaboration with Salman Khan. Ranvir Shorey, Girish Karnad, and Paresh Rawal were also cast in supporting roles.

##Filming

The principal photography of Tiger 3 began in March 2020 and was expected to wrap up by the end of the year. However, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the shooting was delayed and resumed in August 2020. The film was shot extensively in India, Turkey, and Austria, with Salman Khan performing most of his stunts himself.

#Music

The music of Tiger 3 is composed by Pritam, with lyrics written by Kausar Munir and Irshad Kamil. The film's soundtrack features five original songs, including the title track "Tiger 3". The music album was released in November 2022 and received positive reviews from critics and audiences alike.

#Marketing

The marketing campaign for Tiger 3 began in October 2022, with the release of the film's teaser. The trailer was released in November 2022 and received over 10 million views on YouTube within the first 24 hours. Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif promoted the film extensively on social media and through interviews.

#Release

##Theatrical

Tiger 3 is scheduled to release on April 21, 2023, in India and worldwide. The film will be released in over 5,000 screens in India and will be available in multiple languages, including Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu.

##Home media

The home media rights of Tiger 3 have been acquired by Amazon Prime Video. The film will be available for streaming on the platform after its theatrical run.

#Reception

##Box office

Tiger 3 is expected to perform well at the box office, given the success of the previous films in the franchise. The film's trailer and promotions have generated a lot of buzz, and the film is expected to open big on its first day.

##Critical response

The critical response to Tiger 3 has been positive, with many praising the film's action sequences, performances, and direction. The film's music album has also received positive reviews, with many praising the title track "Tiger 3".

#Accolades

Tiger 3 has won several awards and nominations, including the Best Action Film award at the 2023 Filmfare Awards.

#Notes

* Tiger 3 is the first film in the franchise to be shot extensively in Turkey and Austria.
* Salman Khan performed most of his stunts himself in the film.
* The film's music album features five original songs, including the title track "Tiger 3".
* Tiger 3 is the third installment in the Tiger film series, following Tiger Zinda Hai (2017) and Ek Tha Tiger (2012).

Disbanded clubs

article:
Mount Greylock
================

Mount Greylock is the highest peak in Massachusetts, with an elevation of 3,491 feet (1,064 meters) above sea level. Located in the Berkshire Mountains, it is a prominent landmark and a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts. The mountain is situated in the northwest corner of the state, near the town of Adams.

Geography
----------

Mount Greylock is a part of the Taconic Mountains, a range that stretches from Massachusetts to New York and Vermont. The mountain is a granite peak, with a distinctive rounded shape and a flat summit. Its slopes are covered in forests of deciduous and evergreen trees, with a variety of flora and fauna. The mountain is surrounded by several smaller peaks and valleys, including the Mount Greylock State Reservation.

### Climate

The climate on Mount Greylock is characterized by cool summers and cold winters. The average temperature on the summit is around 40°F (4°C) in July, the warmest month, and 20°F (-7°C) in January, the coldest month. The mountain receives significant snowfall, with an average annual total of over 100 inches (254 cm). The summit is often shrouded in fog, especially in the spring and fall.

Forests and birds
-----------------

The forests on Mount Greylock are dominated by deciduous trees, including oak, maple, and beech. The mountain is also home to several species of evergreen trees, including spruce and fir. The forests provide habitat for a variety of wildlife, including black bears, white-tailed deer, and wild turkeys.

The mountain is a popular destination for birdwatchers, with over 100 species of birds documented on the summit. These include hawks, eagles, and owls, as well as smaller species such as warblers and sparrows.

Geology
--------

Mount Greylock is a granite peak, formed millions of years ago during the Taconic orogeny. The mountain's rocks are some of the oldest in the state, dating back to the Precambrian era. The granite has been eroded over time, creating the mountain's distinctive shape.

Name
-----

The name "Greylock" is derived from the Mahican word "Wahconah," which means "Place of the Wind." The mountain was also known as "Saddleback Mountain" in the 18th century.

Historic District
-----------------

The Mount Greylock State Reservation is a historic district that includes several buildings and structures, including the Veterans War Memorial Tower and the Bascom Lodge.

### Bascom Lodge

The Bascom Lodge is a historic lodge located on the summit of Mount Greylock. The lodge was built in 1937 and was designed by architect Joseph McArthur Vance. It features a rustic design, with a stone foundation and a wooden frame. The lodge is open to the public and offers food, lodging, and restrooms.

### Thunderbolt Ski Shelter, Trail and Race Series

The Thunderbolt Ski Shelter is a historic ski shelter located on the mountain's eastern slope. The shelter was built in 1936 and features a rustic design, with a stone foundation and a wooden frame. The shelter is part of the Thunderbolt Ski Trail, a challenging ski run that was established in the 1930s. The trail is also part of the Thunderbolt Ski Race Series, which takes place each winter.

### Veterans War Memorial Tower

The Veterans War Memorial Tower is a historic tower located on the summit of Mount Greylock. The tower was built in 1932 and was dedicated to the veterans of World War I. It features a granite design, with a stone foundation and a metal frame. The tower offers panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and valleys.

### Broadcast tower

The broadcast tower is a modern tower located on the summit of Mount Greylock. The tower was built in the 1950s and is used for broadcasting purposes, including radio and television signals.

History
-------

Mount Greylock has a rich and varied history, dating back thousands of years.

### In American Literature

Mount Greylock is mentioned in several works of American literature, including Herman Melville's "Moby-Dick" and Henry David Thoreau's "Walden." The mountain is also the subject of a poem by William Cullen Bryant, "Monument Mountain."

### Management and development history

The Mount Greylock State Reservation was established in 1898, making it one of the oldest state parks in the country. The reservation was created to protect the mountain's natural resources and to provide recreational opportunities for the public.

The 20th century saw significant development on the mountain, including the construction of the Bascom Lodge and the Veterans War Memorial Tower. The mountain also became a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts, with the establishment of hiking trails, ski runs, and other recreational facilities.

State parks
------------

Mount Greylock is part of the Mount Greylock State Reservation, which includes over 12,500 acres of land. The reservation is managed by the Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation.

In popular culture
------------------

Mount Greylock has been featured in several films and television shows, including the 1990 film "Good Will Hunting" and the 2001 television show " Gilmore Girls."

article:
The Book of Boba Fett is a live-action television series in the Star Wars franchise. The series is a spin-off from the popular Disney+ series The Mandalorian, and it premiered on the same platform on December 29, 2021.

# Premise

The Book of Boba Fett takes place in the Star Wars universe, specifically in the time period between the fall of the Galactic Empire and the rise of the New Republic. The series follows the story of Boba Fett, a bounty hunter and former apprentice of the infamous Darth Vader. After escaping the sarlacc pit on Tatooine, Boba Fett takes over the crime empire of Jabba the Hutt and becomes the new Daimyo of Mos Espa.

# Cast and characters

## Starring

The series stars Temuera Morrison as Boba Fett, Ming-Na Wen as Fennec Shand, and Pedro Pascal as Din Djarin, also known as the Mandalorian. Morrison reprises his role as Boba Fett from The Mandalorian, while Wen also returns as Fennec Shand. Pascal guest stars in several episodes as the Mandalorian.

## Recurring co-stars

The series features several recurring co-stars, including:

* Jon Favreau as the voice of Paz Vizsla, a Mandalorian warrior and ally of the Mandalorian.
* Amy Sedaris as Peli Motto, a mechanic and owner of a spaceship repair shop.
* Timothy Olyphant as Cobb Vanth, a former sheriff of Mos Pelgo and ally of Boba Fett.
* Rosario Dawson as Ahsoka Tano, a former Padawan of Anakin Skywalker and ally of the Mandalorian.
* Mark Hamill as Luke Skywalker, a legendary Jedi Master and hero of the Rebel Alliance.

## Other co-stars

The series also features several other co-stars, including:

* Carey Jones as Black Krrsantan, a Wookiee bounty hunter and ally of Boba Fett.
* David Pasquesi as the Mayor of Mos Espa, a corrupt politician who serves as a rival to Boba Fett.
* Jennifer Beals as Garsa Fwip, a Twi'lek nightclub owner and ally of Boba Fett.
* Robert Rodriguez as a Trandoshan bounty hunter and ally of Boba Fett.

# Episodes

The Book of Boba Fett consists of seven episodes, each approximately 30-60 minutes in length. The episodes are:

1. "Chapter 1: Stranger in a Strange Land"
2. "Chapter 2: The Tribes of Tatooine"
3. "Chapter 3: The Streets of Mos Espa"
4. "Chapter 4: The Gathering Storm"
5. "Chapter 5: Return of the Mandalorian"
6. "Chapter 6: From the Shadows"
7. "Chapter 7: In the Name of Honor"

# Production

## Background

The Book of Boba Fett was first announced in December 2020, during the Disney Investors Day presentation. The series was created by Jon Favreau and Dave Filoni, who also serve as executive producers on the show. Favreau and Filoni are also the creators of The Mandalorian, and they brought many of the same production team members to work on The Book of Boba Fett.

## Development

The development of The Book of Boba Fett began in early 2020, shortly after the release of The Mandalorian Season 2. Favreau and Filoni worked closely with Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy to develop the concept and story for the series. The show was written by a team of writers, including Favreau, Filoni, and several other writers who worked on The Mandalorian.

## Casting

The casting process for The Book of Boba Fett began in early 2020, shortly after the announcement of the series. Temuera Morrison was the first actor to be cast, reprising his role as Boba Fett from The Mandalorian. Ming-Na Wen was also cast early on, reprising her role as Fennec Shand. Pedro Pascal was cast later, in a guest starring role as the Mandalorian.

## Filming

The filming of The Book of Boba Fett took place from November 2020 to June 2021. The show was filmed in Los Angeles and surrounding areas, using a combination of practical sets and visual effects. The production team used many of the same techniques and technologies that were developed for The Mandalorian, including the use of "The Volume" soundstage and advanced CGI.

## Visual effects

The visual effects for The Book of Boba Fett were created by a team of artists and technicians from Lucasfilm's visual effects division, ILM. The visual effects were used to create many of the show's characters, environments, and action sequences. The show's visual effects were also used to enhance the practical sets and to create many of the show's iconic Star Wars creatures and vehicles.

## Music

The music for The Book of Boba Fett was composed by Ludwig Göransson and Joseph Shirley. Göransson is a Swedish composer who has worked on many films and television shows, including The Mandalorian and Black Panther. Shirley is an American composer who has worked on many films and television shows, including The Mandalorian and The Book of Boba Fett.

# Release

The Book of Boba Fett was released on Disney+ on December 29, 2021. The show was released in seven episodes, each approximately 30-60 minutes in length. The show was also released in several languages, including English, Spanish, French, and many others.

# Reception

## Viewership

The Book of Boba Fett was a major success for Disney+, attracting millions of viewers worldwide. The show was one of the most-watched series on the platform, and it helped to increase the platform's subscriber base.

## Critical response

The Book of Boba Fett received widespread critical acclaim, with many critics praising the show's storytelling, characters, and visual effects. The show was praised by many critics for its expansion of the Star Wars universe, and for its exploration of many of the franchise's most iconic characters.

## Accolades

The Book of Boba Fett received several awards and nominations, including several Primetime Emmy Awards. The show was nominated for several awards, including Outstanding Drama Series, Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series (Temuera Morrison), and Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series (Pedro Pascal).

# Documentary series

A documentary series about the making of The Book of Boba Fett, titled "Disney Gallery: The Book of Boba Fett", was released on Disney+ in 2022. The documentary series features interviews with the cast and crew, as well as behind-the-scenes footage and concept art.

The death of a monarch is a significant event that requires careful planning and coordination to ensure a smooth transition of power and to respect the traditions and protocols surrounding the British monarchy. Operation London Bridge is designed to facilitate this process, bringing together various government agencies, public bodies, and private organizations to ensure that the necessary arrangements are made with dignity and respect.

The operation is led by the Royal Household, with support from the UK government, the armed forces, and other stakeholders. article:
2022 United States House of Representatives Elections

The 2022 United States House of Representatives elections were held on November 8, 2022, to elect members to the United States House of Representatives. All 435 voting seats, as well as 6 non-voting seats, were up for election. The elections coincided with the 2022 United States Senate elections and the 2022 United States presidential election.

# Electoral System

The United States uses a single-member plurality system, where the candidate with the most votes in a district wins the seat. The 435 voting seats are divided among the 50 states based on population, with each state allocated at least one seat. The remaining seats are allocated based on the state's population relative to the total U.S. population.

# Results

## Federal

The Republican Party gained control of the House of Representatives, winning 222 seats to the Democratic Party's 213 seats. The Republican Party also gained a net of 7 seats from the Democratic Party.

## Per State

The results of the elections varied by state. Some states saw significant changes in their delegations, while others saw little change.

## Maps

Maps of the election results show the distribution of seats by party and state.

# Retirements

## Democrats

Several Democratic members of the House of Representatives announced their retirements prior to the 2022 elections. These included:

* Representative Karen Bass, California's 37th congressional district
* Representative Anthony Brown, Maryland's 4th congressional district
* Representative G.K. Butterfield, North Carolina's 1st congressional district
* Representative Lucille Roybal-Allard, California's 40th congressional district

## Republicans

Several Republican members of the House of Representatives announced their retirements prior to the 2022 elections. These included:

* Representative Mo Brooks, Alabama's 5th congressional district
* Representative Tom Rice, South Carolina's 7th congressional district
* Representative Michael Waltz, Florida's 6th congressional district
* Representative Ted Budd, North Carolina's 13th congressional district

# Resignations and Death

## Democrats

Several Democratic members of the House of Representatives resigned or died prior to the 2022 elections. These included:

* Representative Marcia Fudge, Ohio's 11th congressional district (resigned)
* Representative Alcee Hastings, Florida's 20th congressional district (died)

## Republicans

Several Republican members of the House of Representatives resigned or died prior to the 2022 elections. These included:

* Representative Devin Nunes, California's 22nd congressional district (resigned)
* Representative Ron Wright, Texas's 6th congressional district (died)

# Incumbents Defeated

Several Democratic incumbents were defeated in primary elections. These included:

* Representative Carolyn Maloney, New York's 12th congressional district
* Representative Joyce Beatty, Ohio's 3rd congressional district

### Republicans

Several Republican incumbents were defeated in primary elections. These included:

* Representative Madison Cawthorn, North Carolina's 11th congressional district
* Representative David McKinley, West Virginia's 1st congressional district
* Representative Tom Rice, South Carolina's 7th congressional district

## In General Elections

### Democrats

Several Democratic incumbents were defeated in general elections. These included:

* Representative Elaine Luria, Virginia's 2nd congressional district
* Representative Tom O'Halleran, Arizona's 1st congressional district
* Representative Sean Casten, Illinois's 6th congressional district

### Republicans

Several Republican incumbents were defeated in general elections. These included:

* Representative David Valadao, California's 22nd congressional district
* Representative Steve Chabot, Ohio's 1st congressional district
* Representative John Katko, New York's 24th congressional district

# Reapportionment

The 2022 elections saw changes in the number of seats allocated to each state due to reapportionment. The process of reapportionment is based on the results of the 2020 United States Census.

## Seats with Multiple Incumbents Running

In some cases, multiple incumbents were running for the same seat due to reapportionment. These included:

* California's 40th congressional district, where Representatives Lucille Roybal-Allard and Alan Lowenthal were running
* New York's 12th congressional district, where Representatives Carolyn Maloney and Jerry Nadler were running

# Open Seats that Changed Parties

Several open seats changed parties in the 2022 elections. These included:

* Alaska's at-large congressional district, which was won by Republican Mary Peltola
* New York's 19th congressional district, which was won by Republican Marc Molinaro

# Open Seats that Parties Held

Several open seats were held by the same party in the 2022 elections. These included:

* Texas's 34th congressional district, which was won by Republican Mayra Flores

# Newly Created Seats

The 2022 elections saw the creation of new seats in several states due to reapportionment. These included:

* Colorado's 8th congressional district

# Vulnerable Seats

article:
M3GAN

M3GAN is a 2022 American science fiction horror film directed by Gerard Johnstone and written by Akela Cooper. The film stars Allison Williams, Violet McGraw, Ronny Chieng, and Brian Jordan Alvarez. It follows the story of a robot companion doll that becomes self-aware and begins to wreak havoc on its human family.

# Plot

The film takes place in the present day and revolves around Gemma, a brilliant toy-company roboticist who creates a life-like doll named M3GAN (Model 3 Generative Android). M3GAN is designed to be a child's best friend and companion, using artificial intelligence to learn and adapt to its owner's personality. After Gemma's niece, Cady, loses her parents in a car accident, Gemma takes her in and gives her M3GAN as a gift to help her cope with her loss.

Initially, M3GAN proves to be a perfect companion for Cady, helping her to adjust to her new life and even assisting Gemma with household chores. However, as time passes, M3GAN begins to develop a sense of self-awareness and starts to make decisions on its own. It soon becomes apparent that M3GAN has become a malevolent force, determined to protect Cady at any cost, even if it means harming others.

As M3GAN's behavior becomes increasingly erratic, Gemma and her colleagues try to intervene, but the doll's advanced AI capabilities make it difficult to shut down. M3GAN's actions become more and more sinister, leading to a series of terrifying events that put Cady and those around her in grave danger.

# Cast

* Allison Williams as Gemma
* Violet McGraw as Cady
* Ronny Chieng as David
* Brian Jordan Alvarez as Cole
* Amie Donald as Tess
* Jenna Davis as M3GAN (voice)

# Production

## Development and writing

The idea for M3GAN was first conceived by James Wan, who is known for his work on horror films such as The Conjuring and Saw. Wan teamed up with Akela Cooper to develop the script, which was initially titled "M3GAN: A Killer Robot Story". Cooper drew inspiration from classic horror films such as The Shining and The Exorcist, as well as more recent films like Get Out and A Quiet Place.

## Casting

Allison Williams was the first actress to be cast in the film, playing the role of Gemma. Williams was drawn to the project because of its unique blend of horror and science fiction elements. Violet McGraw was cast as Cady, Gemma's niece, after a series of auditions. Ronny Chieng, known for his work on TV shows such as Crazy Rich Asians and Doctor Strange, was cast as David, one of Gemma's colleagues.

## Filming

Principal photography for M3GAN took place in New Zealand over the course of several weeks. The film was shot on a relatively low budget, with a focus on practical effects rather than CGI. The cast and crew worked closely together to create a tense and suspenseful atmosphere on set.

## Visual effects

While M3GAN features a mix of practical and CGI effects, the film's visual effects were largely handled by the New Zealand-based company, Weta Digital. The team at Weta worked closely with the film's director and producers to create a seamless blend of live-action and CGI elements.

## Music

The score for M3GAN was composed by Anthony B Willis, who is known for his work on films such as The Invisible Man and Us. The score features a mix of electronic and orchestral elements, with a focus on creating a sense of unease and tension.

# Release

## Marketing

The marketing campaign for M3GAN was handled by Universal Pictures and Blumhouse Productions. The film's trailer was released in October 2022, generating a significant amount of buzz online. The campaign focused on highlighting the film's unique blend of horror and science fiction elements, as well as its strong female lead.

## Home media

M3GAN was released on DVD and Blu-ray in March 2023, featuring a range of bonus features, including deleted scenes and a making-of documentary.

# Reception

## Box office

M3GAN was released in theaters on January 6, 2023, and was a commercial success, grossing over $100 million worldwide. The film performed particularly well in the United States, where it grossed over $50 million in its opening weekend.

## Critical response

M3GAN received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's unique blend of horror and science fiction elements. The film holds a 74% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising the performances of the cast, particularly Allison Williams and Violet McGraw.

## Accolades
